Package udel.GardenProject.windows

Class PlotDesign

  • java.lang.Object
    • udel.GardenProject.windows.Window
      • udel.GardenProject.windows.PlotDesign
  • public class PlotDesign
extends Window
    Heart of the application: Where the user can drag plants, obstacles, shade, text boxes, and interact with their virtual, top-down plot.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Team 0

      • getScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
        Description copied from class: Window
        Abstract. All Windows must specify how they're scene is returned, and what processing they do for it.
        Specified by:
        getScene in class Window
        Returns:

      • addPlotObjectToInterface

        public void addPlotObjectToInterface​(PlotObject po,
                                     double x,
                                     double y)
        NOTE: Does NOT add PlotObject to plot attribute in Session. Only adds a plot object to the interface. This is because if this method did add the passed PlotObject to the plot, then PlotDesign's refresh() would not work because it add already existing PlotObjects to the plot.

        Take in a PlotObject, call its render() method, and set the returned Node's position and attach the necessary handlers to update its position.
        Parameters:
        po - PlotObject being added to the plot.
        x - Horizontal coordinate for the image.
        y - Vertical coordinate for the image.
        background - If this is a background object.
